definition[0]: to answer someone by saying or writing something
example[0]: I asked Clive where he was going, but he didn’t reply.
example[1]: Sorry it took me so long to reply.
example[2]: ‘Did you see Simon today?’ ‘Of course, ’ Nathalie replied with a smile.
example[3]: Has Ian replied to your letter yet?
example[4]: Mills replied that he was staying at his parents’ flat.
explanation[0]: Reply is used especially in written English. In everyday English, people usually say answer:
definition[1]: to react to an action by doing something else
example[5]: The rebel troops replied to government threats with increased violence.
definition[2]: something that is said, written, or done as a way of replying
example[6]: I tried calling, but there was no reply.
example[8]: We still haven’t received a reply to our letter.

definition[3]: to answer someone, in writing or in speech
example[10]: Asked about the bank’s operations, the chairman replied that the record speaks for itself.
example[11]: Our aim is to reply to all letters within 10 working days.
example[12]: The Exchange said it had received a satisfactory reply from the bank.
definition[5]: a letter answering one that has been received
example[14]: I received the standard letter of reply in response to my complaints.

example[15]: In reply to your letter of 24 Jan, I am sorry to hear our product has not met our usual high standards.
